    Elmira Basilio (she/her)

    • Generation 2
    • Role: Heir
    • Currently: Alive, in household
    • Traits:
      • Cautious (Infant)
      • Fussy (Toddler)
      • Fickle
      • Gym Bunny
      • Self-absorbed
    • Relationships:
      • Doba Basilio (Husband)
      • Ajei Basilio (Daughter)
      • Etan Basilio (Twin, BFF)
      • Miguel Basilio (Father)
      • Salim Basilio (Father)
      • Bailey (Pet, Dog)
      • Cosmo (Pet, Cat)
      • Celia Ota (Best friend)
      • George Laurent (Ex-Boyfriend)
      • Sawyer Snow (Ex-Boyfriend)

    Biography

    Growing Up

    Elmira was always hard to please, even from the moment she was born. No amount of playtime was ever enough--at least until she decided something else was dire enough to beg for. She loved the color pink, wearing whatever cute outfits her nannies (and more rarely her fathers) cobbled together for her, and splashing paint around the arts and crafts table in her nursery and later bedroom. As soon as she started school, it became obvious that she inherited Miguel's freakishly social tendencies, and would often be seen with a small crowd of adoring friends (and fans) trailing after her from school or Girl Scouts. No matter what, Etan was always her best friend forever when asked about it.

    Teenage Years

    Elmira didn't care at all about getting good grades or submitting the perfect assignment like her twin brother did. She was much more preoccupied with chasing boys (for the fun of it, not even because she liked them) and making the biggest friend network she possibly could. She loved sneaking off to college parties (something her dads were resigned to letting her do, since she seemed to stay safe) and throwing her own at every chance she got. High school was pretty great for Elmira, less because it was her peak, and more because it was the calm before the storm.

    Young Adulthood

    Pretty soon after she graduated, Elmira and Etan realized their childhood wasn't that great...at all. Not for any lack of effort on their dads' parts, but because they were always out of the house working on bigger things. At least they had a big house with four walls, but how great was that really if the second they became adults marked the beginning of a slough of mental health issues and realizations about their dads. At least Elmira had Cupid's Corner, a full blown obsession with werewolves, and her gym job to distract her...

    Adulthood

    Elmira took after her father, Salim, as she started reaching the wall that was the middle of her life; the time was passing her by and she hadn't even begun to start doing the things she wanted to do. She hated working at the gym, so she quit. She'd finally come to terms with her greyromanticism, and finally felt content enough with the ups and downs that came with that to get into a healthy relationship with a certain Doba Basilio. Who also turned out to be a werewolf. And some how, some way, fate rolled its hand and gave the two of them a daughter, Ajei Basilio, on the day Salim passed away, no less.
